[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: CBWS supports seamless operation across major web browsers, mobile-optimized navigation, and responsive UI scaling.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: CBWS integrates with browser engines, responsive frameworks, and caching services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: CBWS provides a UI that adapts dynamically across devices and screen sizes.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: CBWS operates on desktops, laptops, tablets, and mobile devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: CBWS utilizes HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and React.js for frontend responsiveness.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: CBWS supports network interactions via REST APIs and WebSockets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: CBWS is optimized for lightweight execution, reducing load times on resource-limited devices.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: CBWS ensures full browser support, touch responsiveness, and adaptive layouts.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: CBWS enables UI scaling, smooth animations, and touch-based controls.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: CBWS links to authentication, cloud storage, and session management services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Cross-Browser Web System (CBWS) defines requirements for a web-based system, ensuring full browser compatibility, mobile accessibility, and dynamic UI adaptability.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: CBWS ensures cross-browser compatibility, responsive navigation, and mobile-optimized performance.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: CBWS is designed for users accessing from desktops, laptops, and mobile devices with no prior technical expertise required.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Mobile support of CBWS ensures usability but may not replicate full desktop features.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: CBWS relies on modern web standards, browser updates, and mobile platform support.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Cross-Browser Compatibility: Ensures uniform system operation across web browsers.
Mobile Accessibility: Optimized navigation and UI adaptation for touch-based devices.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall maintain consistent feature behavior across supported browsers with dynamic layout adjustments (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall adapt to different screen sizes, ensuring optimal usability on mobile devices (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall ensure full functionality across major web browsers.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide a mobile-friendly UI with adaptive touch-based navigation.

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a responsive UI with smooth animations and adaptive touch controls.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store UI preferences and caching configurations for seamless multi-device transitions.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall ensure minimal performance degradation on mobile browsers, maintaining response times under 3 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall adhere to modern web design principles for consistent cross-platform experience.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and accessibility guidelines.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall optimize mobile interactions while maintaining full browser functionality.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Cross-browser compatibility, UI responsiveness, and mobile adaptation validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, browser compatibility reports, and mobile UI policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Web standards, cross-browser testing frameworks, and mobile optimization best practices.
